intro: Bunchosia guatemalensis var. pardensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan bunchosia, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a rough texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
